ðŸš€ clifm | C
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To provide a powerful and efficient file management experience directly within the command line interface, suitable for users who prefer terminal-based workflows and need compatibility with minimal terminal environments.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Shell-like command-line interaction â€¢ No GUI or TUI â€¢ Bookmarks, search, file selection, tags, filters â€¢ File previews (including images) â€¢ Bulk rename, archiving, trash
ðŸ“– Summary: Clifm is a shell-like, command-line file manager written in C. It provides powerful file management capabilities directly within the terminal, without relying on a graphical or text-based user interface, making it highly compatible with various terminal environments.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ museeks | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: A user-friendly, cross-platform desktop application for playing and managing music collections.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Cross-platform music player (Linux, macOS, Windows) â€¢ Supported audio formats: mp3, mp4, m4a/aac, flac, wav, ogg, 3gpp â€¢ Library auto-refresh â€¢ Playlists â€¢ Queue management
ðŸ“– Summary: Museeks is a simple, clean, and cross-platform music player built with Electron and React. It focuses on core music playback features like library management, playlists, queue control, and playback speed adjustments, offering a straightforward user experience on Linux, macOS, and Windows.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ termux-desktop | Shell
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To install and run a full Linux desktop environment on an Android device using Termux, enabling a graphical user interface and hardware acceleration.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Easy Setup â€¢ Multiple Desktop Styles (Xfce, LXQt, Openbox, etc.) â€¢ Hardware Acceleration driver installation â€¢ GUI Access via Termux:X11 (default) or VNC (optional) â€¢ Package Management with APT and optional PACMAN
ðŸ“– Summary: Termux-Desktop is a shell script designed to easily install and manage Linux desktop environments and window managers within the Termux environment on Android devices. It supports various desktop styles, enables hardware acceleration, and offers options for GUI access via Termux:X11 or VNC, along with package management and containerization capabilities.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ open-scouts | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Automated web monitoring and notification for specific information discovery.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Create AI scouts for automated web searching â€¢ Receive email alerts upon finding target information â€¢ Continuous 24/7 web monitoring â€¢ Scalable dispatcher architecture using Supabase â€¢ Vector embeddings for semantic search on execution summaries
ðŸ“– Summary: Open Scouts is an AI-powered web monitoring platform that allows users to create automated 'scouts' to continuously search the web for specific information. When a scout finds the desired content, it sends an email notification to the user, ensuring they stay updated on relevant changes or new information.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ openscreen | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Creating product demos, tutorials, and walkthrough videos with customizable screen recordings.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Record whole screen or specific apps â€¢ Add manual zooms with customizable depth, duration, and position â€¢ Crop video recordings â€¢ Choose backgrounds (wallpapers, solid colors, gradients, custom images) â€¢ Apply motion blur for smoother effects
ðŸ“– Summary: OpenScreen is a free, open-source desktop application for creating high-quality screen recordings and product demos. It offers essential features like screen/app recording, customizable zooms, annotations, and background customization, serving as a simpler alternative to paid software like Screen Studio.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source
